description: A slightly calmer start to the week may be needed, so take a maximum of 6 km there so you can bring home all the training done and to come. Because the rest of the week and the coming weeks are tough. Be responsive and remove/lighten trainings if you need to. The fast distance is long; and tough and late for the weekend, you skip the short downhill section if you are tired. More important to get the long run.

Fast Distance run. If everything feels good, you can be spurred on by pushing the time, and hopefully it will go a little faster now than at the beginning of our training program. Target image around 5.00 min/km at speed.

However, think about the whole of your training where no single session must be too hard. Worn out; Run through without a time ambition, and above all let the body get into the session through a slightly softer introduction to your 7 km fast distance.

Extra sessions that you only include in your total if you feel energetic, and you feel that you responded well to the program's training. Calm distance of 3+3 km where you stop during the round (in the proposal after 3 km and the distance is written as warm-up and jog down) ) and put in a 5x100 meter short hill with a springy step.

Take a little rest up/down (5 -10s) and have a calm jog downhill as your rest as well.

Focus on getting a little pressure uphill without getting really tired!

Good combo with the long session IF you are physically fit in general!

A record for the program. Adapt to your feeling! Shorten it if it feels too tough.

Bring drinks; and time to start testing your energy plan for the marathon!
